summary: D. J. Brennan, Jr. is mentioned in several documents related to CIA and FBI activities. One memo is addressed to him from S.J. Papich regarding a CIA operation to create a fake U.S.-based communist organization. Other documents mention CIA activities, including potential funding of the National Council of Churches, handling of alien interview requests, and the handling of sensitive information received from the CIA concerning "Bureau Informant 100" (James Angleton) and SCOPE material. Brennan is also mentioned in a document involving coordination between the CIA and FBI regarding the release of JFK assassination-related documents.
significance: D. J. Brennan, Jr.'s significance in the JFK context is related to his involvement in the coordination between the CIA and FBI regarding the release of JFK assassination-related documents. The documents suggest he was involved in discussions regarding the protection of informant identities and the release of agent-specific data.
